definitions.definition: (a building designed to give) protection from bad weather, danger, or attack:
to protect yourself from bad weather, danger, or attack:
examples: We took shelter for the night in an abandoned house.

definitions.definition: to protect yourself, or another person or thing, from bad weather, danger, or attack:
examples: We were caught in a thunderstorm, without anywhere to shelter.

definitions.definition: to give someone a secret hiding place so that they will not be caught by the army, police, etc.:
examples: Local people risked their own lives to shelter resistance fighters from the army.
